title: KAPy configuration options
description: Configuration schema for KAPy configuration objects. These configurations are usually stored in the `config.yaml` file in the root directory of the project.

configurationTables.description: Paths to configuration tables. See the documentation for each table separately

inputs.description: Path to input configuration table, relative to working directory. See [inputs.md](inputs.md) for more detail.

secondaryVars.description: Path to configuration table for secondary variables, relative to working directory. See [derivedVars.md](derivedVars.md) for more details. Optional - if omitted, no secondary variables will be generated

indicators.description: Path to indicator configuration table, relative to working directory. See [indicators.md](indicators.md) for more detail.

scenarios.description: Path to scenario configuration table, relative to working directory. See [scenarios.md](scenarios.md) for more detail.

periods.description: Path to period configuration table, relative to working directory. See [periods.md](periods.md) for more detail.

seasons.description: Path to season configuration table, relative to working directory. See [seasons.md](seasons.md) for more detail.

dirs.description: Directories for storing output and intermediate files. Can be specified as either absolute paths, or relative to the working directory. See the [KAPy concepts](../KAPy_concepts.md) documentation for a more detailed description of these items

regridded.description: Directory for storing indicators regridded to a common grid.

arealstats.description: Directory for storing statistics calculated over areas.

notebooks.description: Directory for storing compiled Jupyter notebooks.

calcForMembers.description: Should the areal statistics be calculated for the individual ensemble members as well as for the entire ensemble. `true` or `false`.

cutouts.description: Configures spatial-subsetting (cutting-out) of the input data.

oneOf.description: `None`. Omit the cutout step. All available data in the input files is processed.
`lonlatbox`. Use the `sellonlatbox`operator from cdo to do the subsetting. Details of this operator can be found in the CDO documentation.

ensembles.description: Specify the percentiles [0-100] calculated from the ensemble. We allow three values, corresponding to the upper and lower confidence limits, and the central value.

outputGrid.description: Defines the common output grid onto which KAPy interpolates all indicators before calculating ensemble statistics. Multiple approaches to regridding can be configured, as described below.

oneOf.description: `None`. Omit the regridding step. Assumes that all files within an input type are on the same grid, which will be used as the output grid

`cdo`. Use the Climate Data Operators to do the regridding. For more information, see the CDO website, https://code.mpimet.mpg.de/projects/cdo. Installation of CDO is handled behind the scenes by conda as part of the KAPy environment setup - be aware that this may result in a different version of CDO being used to what you have by default. In the current configuration we default to bilinear interpolation (`remapbil`). If other operators are required, please file a feature request in GitHub. More information about CDO interpolation, can be found in section 2.12 of the documention.

cdoGriddes.description: Path to CDO grid descriptor, specifying the output grid. For more information see the CDO document, especially Appendix D and section 2.12 on interpolation.
